The [LOCATION] bed and the gorge are positioned in such a way that they are shaded for most of the day, except in the mornings.  On this particular day, I planned to bring [FRIEND1], [FRIEND2], [FRIEND3], and [FRIEND4]. [FRIEND1] is a daredevil. Despite his lack of athletic prowess, he is willing to attempt almost anything. He was homeschooled until his freshman year of high school, making him socially awkward and unaccustomed to resisting negative peer pressure. In contrast, I am the type to engage in crazy stunts but have the ability to execute them successfully. I was performing gainers off a [HEIGHT1] - foot cliff above the water. Somehow, [FRIEND1] was pressured into attempting one as well. As he mentally prepared for the stunt, we provided a countdown: [COUNT1], [COUNT2], [COUNT3], [GO]! He ran to the cliff - side as I had demonstrated, jumped out, and brought his knees to his chest. However, the problem was that he tucked but failed to rotate. He plummeted like a rock, his back facing the water. There was a seemingly [PAUSE] - second interval between his jump and his impact with the water. His upper back made the first contact, creating a huge splash and a sound akin to a small firecracker. [SECONDS] later, [FRIEND1] emerged from the water, gasping for air but unable to inhale. [FRIEND2], [FRIEND3], [FRIEND4], and I were on the opposite shore. We exchanged worried glances and immediately rushed into the water. It was a [SWIM] - yard swim to reach [FRIEND1]. I was the first to arrive. By then, he was breathing heavily but still in a state of panic. I kept my distance until [FRIEND4] arrived. [FRIEND4], who is nearly 6'[HEIGHT] and [WEIGHT] pounds, grabbed [FRIEND1] around the torso, and I took hold of his legs. When [FRIEND3] and [FRIEND2] finally reached us, they grasped his arms. We pulled him to the beach, where he could stand on dry land. One can only imagine what would have happened if the panicked [FRIEND1] had tried to reach the beach alone. In hindsight, it was somewhat my fault for pressuring him in the first place.  After nearly [HOURS] of relaxing in the sun and calming down, the sun began to set behind the gorge, and shadows encroached upon us from the shoreline. It was only [TIME]. We decided to explore further down [LOCATION] in search of more sunlight. As we stood up, we noticed that [FRIEND1]'s entire backside was purple. This was not only due to his fair skin but also the result of the impact with the water, which had caused a significant contusion. Everyone except [FRIEND1] saw it and burst into laughter at the recollection of the incident. [FRIEND1] looked behind him, saw his discolored back, and couldn't contain his laughter either. Laughter filled the air.  This was the first time [FRIEND1], [FRIEND2], [FRIEND3], [FRIEND4], and I had hung out together. Laughter was the catalyst that brought us closer. Now, we share my [LOCATION] spot with our other friends, but that day remains etched in my memory. To this day, we still reminisce about that scorching [DAY] at [PLACE] when [FRIEND1] attempted a gainer off the cliff. Laughter truly is the shortest distance between people.

I harbor a distinct aversion to computers. This sentiment is not merely a passing whim but a firmly held stance. Computers, with their complex algorithms and often - confounding interfaces, fail to elicit any positive emotions from me. They represent a world of technology that I find difficult to navigate and connect with. In a world where computers have become ubiquitous, my dislike for them stands as a testament to the diversity of human preferences. Despite their many purported benefits, for me, the cons far outweigh the pros. Whether it's the hours spent troubleshooting technical glitches or the sense of isolation that can come with excessive screen time, computers simply do not hold any appeal. In conclusion, my aversion to computers is a deeply ingrained part of my personality, and I see no reason for it to change in the foreseeable future.

Laughter is an integral aspect of my family. We share laughter, we share breaths, and we shall share the journey of life to its end. It matters not what the situation may be; there is always a moment when we experience the best times, even during points when one of us would rather not see the others.  I was spending an adventurous day with one of my close friends at @LOCATION1. We decided it was time to return home and prepare so that I could spend the night at her house. "I cannot believe you all cannot simply go next door to @PERSON2's house and request toilet paper. I have been sitting anxiously on the toilet, hoping you would bring me toilet paper for an hour. Instead, they came to our house and asked for our plunger, which is far more embarrassing," @PERSON1 stated. As soon as those words forcefully left his mouth, we began to guffaw. It felt as though my stomach was tightening so severely that I could scarcely breathe.  With as much attitude as one could muster in their tone of voice, @ORGANIZATION1 declared, "You all do not need toilet paper to clean yourselves! You could have easily stepped into the shower and used the showerhead to wash off the feces!" At that point, there was no going back from what she had said. My step - dad was enraged that she would even utter such a thing. Without hesitation, he quickly picked up the phone and dialed my mother's number, waiting and waiting for her to answer.  Suddenly, @LOCATION1 and I heard a voice on the phone. @PERSON1 began shouting, informing my mom about the situation. It reached a point where he said some words that he ought not to have. As the words rolled off his tongue, he began to stutter. He spoke, "There was no toilet paper, and @ORGANIZATION1 would not go and fetch me some from @PERSON2's house. Unfortunately, I had to get up, wet my hand, and wash it after I wiped my butt with my own hand." There was no stopping us from laughing as hard as we could. I had never heard of something so revolting that made me want to vomit all over our leather couches.  He was so anxious to take my sister's phone that he immediately asked for it before confronting my mother about it. He did not care even if my mom told him that he could not take it away. He desired possession of it so that he knew how my sister would feel. Not only did he take away her phone, but he also deprived her of the right to use toilet paper after using the bathroom. I do not know how long I laughed about that, but it felt as though I was on the verge of urinating on myself.  As @LOCATION1 and I continued laughing, he ran up the stairs as swiftly as he could, rummaging through all the bathrooms in our house to collect every last square of toilet paper that was there. The sad part was that he even removed the showerhead so that my sister would not be able to use it to clean herself. My mother returned home, and there was nothing to say. My sister had said there was no toilet paper, and when he asked if there were napkins, she also replied, "No." He started searching through cabinets and soon found napkins. He was extremely angry, yet at the same time, laughing heartily. He felt that he should look for the brighter side of the situation. A week has passed, and my step - dad, @PERSON1, still has not placed one roll of toilet paper in the bathroom. He said, "You all think it's amusing when it happens to me, but it will be amusing when you all do not have any toilet paper.

Laughter is a vital component of any relationship, be it with family, friends, or a significant other. Allow me to elucidate why it holds such importance. There were two weeks remaining of the school year, and my family had planned a week - long camping trip. Eventually, school concluded, and as we bid farewell to our friends, saying "see you next year," my parents arrived to pick us up in what my dad referred to as an "@CAPS1," which resembled an ordinary school bus. We then embarked on our journey to the camping site.  One might assume that camping is an activity that brings a family together and fosters enjoyment. However, my brothers were engrossed in their video games, my mom and sister were both preoccupied with their phones, while my dad was driving. I even inquired as to why they had brought electronic devices, and all I received in response was a simple "because." Eventually, I decided to let the matter go and read until we reached our camp site.  Finally, we arrived. The first thing we did was unload the @CAPS1 and set everything up to ensure our comfort. That same night, we were all gathered around the warm campfire. As usual, my family was entertained by their video games, cell phones, or whatever they deemed necessary in the wilderness. As I sat by the fire, I gazed at the stars above and began to wonder if my family would always be this way, never evolving into a close - knit, fun, or exciting unit.  The following morning, after we had all awakened, my parents were preparing breakfast. My mom asked me if I remembered to close the @CAPS1 door before retiring to my tent. I admitted that I had forgotten. Knowing my mom's nature, she became slightly irate and asked my sister to close it. As she approached the door, she heard noises and entered to investigate. Before I could even blink, I saw her sprinting out of the @CAPS1, screaming at the top of her lungs. Right behind her was a group of raccoons in pursuit!  My dad, attempting to be a hero, rushed towards them, trying to scare them off, but he failed and was bitten on his butt. Fortunately, my dad was @CAPS5, but while we were all distracted, the raccoons made off with our food. My dad was so furious that he kicked the only log that was preventing the @CAPS1 from rolling away. Immediately, it began to move. We watched as it rolled down the hill and into a lake. Slowly, it started to disappear. Once it was completely out of sight, we all stood by the lake, staring at the large body of water that had swallowed our @CAPS1, wondering what we would do without a vehicle.  As we made our way back to the camp site, all that could be heard for miles was my family arguing. Not paying attention to what was in front of them, my mom fell into a mud pit, and my dad tried to assist her but slipped in as well. Once they emerged, they looked extremely outraged, as if they were ready to challenge Mother Nature to a fight.  Upon our return to the camp site, we sat down. I took a good look at each of us. Our clothes were wet and covered in mud, we were all hungry, and not in the best of moods. I sat there and said, "Dad, do not get even more angry, but I thought it was quite funny when the raccoon bit your butt," and I showed him the picture I had taken at the time. My family then looked at it and began to laugh uncontrollably. Suddenly, we started conversing and truly acting like a family!  We decided to walk home and hitchhike. We walked down the road for approximately an hour until we were given a ride by a local trucker we spotted down the road. Once we arrived home, we engaged in more conversation, spent more time together, and became the ideal family I had always wished for. That camping trip transformed us all, and I am grateful for it because now my family and I are closer than ever. This is how I can demonstrate that laughter is an essential part of any relationship.

When one engages in laughter, is it a result of ingrained habit, or is there a specific cause? What are the underlying causes for laughter? Is there even such a concept as a "cause" for mirth? I am certain that if one were to solicit a scientist's perspective, an in - depth, technical explication regarding the cause of laughter would be provided; yet, does this imply that laughing is merely a signal dispatched from the brain to the requisite muscles? Assuredly not! The genuine cause is what has been said or done to prompt the brain to transmit the message to the appropriate muscles, physically inducing a person to laugh. So, what elicits laughter from people? A comical jest, a senseless deed, a misunderstanding? It can be anything! Undoubtedly, one factor that makes people laugh is spending a delightful period with one or two friends. On @DATE1, @CAPS3's older sister @PERSON4 and I unwittingly embarked on an adventure. We were headed to @LOCATION2, @LOCATION1 to visit our dearest friends, @PERSON2 and @PERSON3, who happened to possess personalities almost entirely akin to those of @CAPS3's sister and me; @PERSON2 being reminiscent of @PERSON4 and @PERSON3 being similar to me. Whenever the four of us congregated, there was no foretelling what kind of humorous and ludicrous memories we would carry home; all we knew was that socializing together never failed to brighten our days and bring a smile to our faces. On this particular day, both @PERSON3 and I were in dire need of each other's undivided attention and uplifting spirits. Both she and I had been experiencing a trying phase with some friends at our schools (strangely enough, we were both having friendship issues with someone named @PERSON1, despite not attending the same school). After some deliberation between both sets of our parents, they consented to have @PERSON2 pick up @LOCATION3, @PERSON4 pick me up, and we would all meet somewhere to divert our minds from the distressing situations we were both enduring. We decided to convene in @LOCATION2, at @PERSON2 and @PERSON3's residence. As we pulled into their driveway, I could sense an overwhelming surge of excitement coursing through my body, as if the emotion was confined within a storage vessel too small to contain its contents. Before the car engine had fully shut off, I had unbuckled my seat - belt and was halfway out of the car door. I slammed the door shut once I had extricated myself and dashed towards the entrance. To my astonishment, the door was unlocked! I pushed it open, shouting boisterously, "I'm heeeeeeeereeeeeeee!" A peal of laughter filled the room. I embraced both of them tightly, and almost as if @PERSON3 and I had pre - planned our next move, we immediately commenced chatting about the events that had transpired that day as we took a seat on the couch. All that could be heard were exclamations like, "@CAPS2 @CAPS3 @CAPS4! I have to tell you what happened today!" and "I can't believe she said that!" or "...and she said...and then I was like...so then she says..." It was as if we had stepped into the life of a drama - filled teen straight out of the movies. Things were progressing as they typically would; @PERSON2 and @PERSON4 were seated near @PERSON3 and me in the dining room at the far end of the couch where we sat, still thoroughly engrossed in our parallel freshman - year - of - high - school worlds. They were completely immersed in their own discussions of past memories we'd shared. Suddenly, @PERSON2 exclaimed, "@CAPS2! @PERSON3 and I baked you brownies!" Caught off - guard by his interjection, we all once again dissolved into laughter, this time making our way towards the kitchen in search of the aforementioned brownies. When we arrived, a pan of brownies was placed on the middle counter. @PERSON3 uncovered it and provided each of us with a napkin upon which a brownie rested. We stood together, leaning against the tiled counters, savoring our brownies and each other's company. Suddenly, a lull descended; no one was speaking. As if to fill the silence before a non - existent timer expired, @PERSON2 blurted out, "@PERSON4, do you wear a wig?" Never in our lives had any of us laughed as heartily as we did at that moment. @PERSON3 collapsed to the floor, @PERSON2 and @PERSON4 were leaning on each other for support to avoid falling, and I was doubled over, desperately trying to keep the sip of milk I had just taken from spilling out of my mouth. Minutes passed, and we were still chuckling at the off - the - mark remark. To this day, @PERSON4 and I reminisce about that afternoon and the shared laughter with our dearest friends.
